column4: How do I navigate to a file through the terminal? I'm not finding any information on it.
case is important.  So: cd Desktop
go to Desktop, then go to Android-sdk/tools/android
or you can provide a full path (note ~ expands to your $HOME): cd ~/Desktop/Android-sdk/tools/android
then go to the directory it is in
what directory are you in now? Type « pwd »
that's not the output of pwd
great.  You can check that the android-sdk-linux directory is in your current directory (~/Desktop), by listing all of the files first.  Type « ls »
so, now you can "cd" to it.  Do that now
yes, though I think you don't have java installed
well if you really want that version of java, I guess so
you should be able to use the openjdk as far as I know
Finally, Android opens. Thanks for the help.
